snippet: Robert Cartagena, found guilty of murdering Tayshana Murphy during a feud between groups of youths in Harlem, faces 25 years to life in prison for intentional murder.
abstract: Manhattan jury finds Robert Cartagena guilty of murdering Tayshana Murphy during a feud between groups of youths in Harlem in 2011; he faces 25 years to life in prison; Tyshawn Brockington, who was with Cartagena, was convicted of second-degree murder in 2013 in a separate trial at which many of the same witnesses testified.
lead_paragraph: Robert Cartagena, found guilty of murdering Tayshana Murphy during a feud between groups of youths in Harlem, faces 25 years to life in prison for intentional murder.

headline.main: Jury Convicts Second Man in 2011 Killing of a High School Basketball Star
headline.print_headline: Jury Convicts Second Man in 2011 Killing of a High School Basketball Star
